title: Counselor Interview
Interview Descriptions: Contacted me twice and stood me up on a virtual interview and tried reaching back out to me days later. Called and emailed twice then the CEO himself had to reach out to me
Interview Questions: Didn’t get that far in the process

title: Operation Interview
Interview Descriptions: It’s straight forward. Dexterity test and then if you pass that you get an interview and you do the aptitude test and all the test that are out there. Problem solving questions too. Go through your cv

title: Behavior Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Hillside (Atlanta, GA) in Nov 2017
Interview Descriptions: After applying online I had a panel interview with Program Managers/hiring managers. I met with HR afterwards and then offered the job.  The team was pleasant and a very positive atmosphere.
Interview Questions: Different scenarios and how I would handle them

title: RN Interview
Application Type: I applied online. The process took 1 week. I interviewed at Hillside (Atlanta, GA) in Jan 2016
Interview Descriptions: Two part after initial phone call from HR . However The DON has left since that time and the process different since and less formal now . Referral is great to have but not required.

title: Behavior Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied in-person. I interviewed at Hillside (Atlanta, GA)
Interview Descriptions:
Applied for 3 years before call
Called by HR
Interviewed by supervisor
Basic questioned posed in interviewing

2 week training
3 day shadowing
Restraint training was useful
All other training redundant..
Nothing else to say on interview process...kind of lack luster
Interview Questions: My work history and how I would benefit the company...

title: Cashier Interview
Application Type: I applied through college or university. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Hillside (Rochester, NY) in Aug 2014
Interview Descriptions: A day in life type interview, checked if I'm comfortable with all the currency denominations. How would you greet a customer, Checked my fluency with English and etiquette. Finally, I was on my way.. It was very easy..Probably one of the easiest and most demanding job to get on campus
Interview Questions: How many cents are there in a Dime, Quarter, Nickel etc

title: Behavioral Specialist Interview
Application Type: I applied through other source. The process took 1 day. I interviewed at Hillside (Atlanta, GA) in May 2013
Interview Descriptions: Easy.. Basic questions about experience working with adolescents with mental and behavioral issues. In addition to how comfortable you'll be to go "hands- on" Most of the interview was conversational. It was a panel of 4 and we mainly conversed about the organization and how to be successful in my position.
Interview Questions: What ideas can you bring to the table for activities to keep the patients busy?
